history.content:
Hello- if you're an EECS major, you may not enroll in any technical courses P/NP unless it is your final semester. Regarding the recording, I would suggest contacting Professor Stojanovic to see if he has plans to record his course. 

From http://engineering.berkeley.edu/academics/undergraduate-guide/procedures-and-regulations: 

Technical courses, whether required of the major or not,  must be taken for a letter grade. Note: During the final semester, if a student is on the official degree list, they may take technical courses on a P/NP basis if the courses are not required for graduation.

Hi, I'm going to be a senior next semester and I would like to take EE141 and EE149 but unfortunately they land on the same time. May I know if there is any plan of lecture recording for these two classes? I talked to the professor teaching EE149 next semester and he said the structure of the class will be changed so the old lectures will be outdated. Also, may I know the policy of enrolling in a technical class on a P/NP basis in a non-graduating semester? Do I just need to get the approval from the professor?
history.subject: EE149 and EE141 lecture recording next Fall
